chapter.title: Supported Systems
chapter.subtitle: Supported UNIX-like OSes
chapter.para: The following are the systems that OpenNMS is supported or known to run on.

sect1.title: Fully Supported
sect1.para: The following Linux distributions are supported out-of-the-box with native installation packages.

formalpara.title: RedHat 7.x
formalpara.para: On RedHat 7.2 and up, it is suggested that you use the official RedHat PostgreSQL RPMs that come with your distribution. However, for OpenNMS to work correctly, you will need to make sure that tcp sockets are enabled. It is also suggested that you increase the maximum number of connections and buffers.

listitem.para:
To do so, start postgresql with the command 'service postgresql start' (to make sure that PostgreSQL's init has created your data directory), and then edit the file '/var/lib/pgsql/data/postgresql.conf' and make sure it has the following lines:
tcpip_socket = true max_connections = 256 shared_buffers = 1024
Then run 'service postgresql restart' to restart with the new configuration.

If you do use the PostgreSQL RPMs provided with OpenNMS, you will need the readline41 compatibility RPM installed, because our RPMs were built against RedHat 7.0. You can get it off your RedHat 7.2 CD, or at RedHat's FTP site.
Note that if you use the "lynx installer", these options will automatically be added for you, and postgresql will be restarted.

formalpara.title: Mandrake 8.x
formalpara.para: Please note that while we build packages for Mandrake 8.x, we do not do any formal testing on it. Packages are provided as a convenience.

sect1.title: Unsupported
sect1.para: The following UNIX systems are unsupported, but have been known to work.

formalpara.title: Solaris 7 and 8
formalpara.para: There have been reports of OpenNMS building and running on Solaris on the discuss list.

formalpara.title: Debian Woody
formalpara.para: Debian packages for OpenNMS are in-progress, and are expected to work before a 1.0 release of OpenNMS.

formalpara.title: MacOS X
formalpara.para: OpenNMS is known to build and run on OSX.
